page.title: 12Lifesaving Club
page.content: TOURISM. {Tintagel Surf Lifesaving Club. In 1961 local residents and police felt the need to provide life- saving cover at{Trebarwith Strand. At the first meeting Fred Whiting was elected chairman and Pam Inman secretary. With the start of a life- guard service by{Camelford R.D.C.}the club increased, members patrolling voluntarily at weekends. Roy Crosley took over as secretary and his & Fred Whiting's efforts kept the club going. The Club has always had{lifeguards}at Trebarwith. The first was Harry Lines, then Richard Whiting,Don Bain,Les Freke,Ben Bamford & Adrian Nute. The Club has rescued 400 people since its formation and its members have gained 39 bronze,3 silver & 3 instructor awards. Its 1985 strength is 48 senior & 23 junior members.
